wikipedia_page.main: General John Studholme Hodgson (1757 – 10 January 1846) was a British Army officer who served as colonel of the 4th (King's Own) Regiment of Foot.

response: On 20 March 1823, following the death of James Balfour, John Hodgson succeeded to the colonelcy of the 83rd Regiment.Memoirs and Services of the Eighty-Third Regiment (London, 1908), 41.

link_mentions.page: List of British Army full generals

response: * John Hodgson (British Army officer) (1757–1846), British general
* John Hodgson (Australian politician) (1799–1860), Australian politician and mayor of Melbourne
* John Hodgson (antiquary) (1779–1845), English clergyman and antiquary
* John Hodgson (footballer, born 1922) (1922–1973), English footballer for Leeds United and Middlesbrough
* John Hodgson (footballer, born 1900) (1900–1959), English football for Brentford
* John Hodgson (Wisconsin politician) (1812–1869), English-born Wisconsin politician
General Studholme John Hodgson (c. 1803 – 30 August 1890) was the General Officer Commanding, Ceylon.

Hodgson was born in Ipswich and baptised on 5 May 1803. He was the son of General John Hodgson and his wife, Catherine Krempion. His younger brother, John Studholme Hodgson (1805-1870) was a major general in the Bengal Army.

link_mentions.page: List of governors of dependent territories in the 19th century

response: *John Hodgson (British Army officer) (1757–1846), Governor of Bermuda from 1806 to 1810
